summary: Color selection control offering swatches, hex input and preview for UI theming.
recommendations: Use the `color` prop for controlled usage — the component reacts to external changes and keeps the native color picker and hex text input in sync.
The deprecated `initialColor` prop sets an initial uncontrolled value; migrate to `color` for consistent controlled behaviour.
Provide `onColorChange` to receive updates; the callback fires on both native picker and hex text input changes, debounced at 50 ms.
The hex text input only triggers `onColorChange` for valid hex values — invalid intermediate typing is shown in the input but not propagated.
Wrap in a `Form` with a `formconfig` to integrate with the form validation system; if no `formconfig` is provided, an internal one with hex validation is created automatically.
Use `maxWidth` (CSS length or percentage) to constrain the picker container width, e.g. `300px` or `50%`.
Use `label` (required) to provide a visible label; pass `replacements` if the label contains translation placeholders.
Use `testId` to attach data-testid attributes to both the native color input (`{testId}-color`) and the text input (`{testId}-text`).
